habitat_description:
The Oregon slender salamander is restricted to western Oregon from the south side of the Columbia River Gorge into the Cascade Mountains to southern Lane County; Populations are almost exclusive to the west slopes of the Cascades (Kirk and Forbes 1991; Lannoo 2005). Elevational range includes sites at 15 meters in the Columbia Gorge, up to 1430 meters (Nussbaum et al. 1983; Petranka 1998; Green et al. 2013; Stebbins 2003). 
Habitat occupied by this species includes decaying logs and stumps in mature forests. They occur in a variety of woody debris (Bury and Corn 1988), but also on lava flows (Nussbaum et al. 1983; Petranka 1998). Leonard et al. (1993) reported that Oregon slender salamanders hide under rocks covered with moss in stabilized talus.
